segments.content: This week the React 19 stable release that we expected very soon is delayed a bit due to a controversial change in how Suspense behaves.
segments.sourceMdx: This week the React 19 stable release that we expected very soon is delayed a bit due to a controversial change in how Suspense behaves.

segments.content: On the React Native side, the first RC of 0.75 is expected very soon, running under React 19.
segments.sourceMdx: On the React Native side, the first RC of 0.75 is expected very soon, running under React 19.

segments.content: **[The Category-Defining React Grid for Your Enterprise ](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[The Category-Defining React Grid for Your Enterprise ](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid)**

segments.content: Data grids are complex components of web applications, but current solutions are inefficient, require a lot of maintenance, and perform poorly. [Graphite Grid](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid) transforms the landscape with two key features: retargetable rendering and reactive signal state.
segments.sourceMdx: Data grids are complex components of web applications, but current solutions are inefficient, require a lot of maintenance, and perform poorly. [Graphite Grid](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid) transforms the landscape with two key features: retargetable rendering and reactive signal state.

segments.content: **Graphite Grid** separates grid state from view logic, allowing a single unified state model to support a variety of render targets, declaratively or imperatively. It includes a **DOM and Canvas** renderer, giving developers flexible, high-performance options ğŸš€.
segments.sourceMdx: **Graphite Grid** separates grid state from view logic, allowing a single unified state model to support a variety of render targets, declaratively or imperatively. It includes a **DOM and Canvas** renderer, giving developers flexible, high-performance options ğŸš€.

segments.content: Graphite Grid is declarative and consistent, leveraging state signals to ensure seamless integration with your application. Designed with **React in mind**, it is the only JavaScript data grid built with React's state management primitives. [Try it now!](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid/demo)
segments.sourceMdx: Graphite Grid is declarative and consistent, leveraging state signals to ensure seamless integration with your application. Designed with **React in mind**, it is the only JavaScript data grid built with React's state management primitives. [Try it now!](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid/demo)

segments.content: ![Suspense with siblings](/emails/issues/190/suspense.jpg)
segments.sourceMdx: ![Suspense with siblings](/emails/issues/190/suspense.jpg)

segments.content: **[React 19 and Suspense - A Drama in 3 Acts](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/react-19-and-suspense-a-drama-in-3-acts)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[React 19 and Suspense - A Drama in 3 Acts](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/react-19-and-suspense-a-drama-in-3-acts)**

segments.content: React 19 RC.0 was released 2 weeks ago and could have become the React 19 stable release we've been waiting for. Unfortunately, it contains a controversial change to the Suspense behavior, leading the React team to talk and decide to delay the release until a solution is found.
segments.sourceMdx: React 19 RC.0 was released 2 weeks ago and could have become the React 19 stable release we've been waiting for. Unfortunately, it contains a controversial change to the Suspense behavior, leading the React team to talk and decide to delay the release until a solution is found.

segments.content: Unlike React 18, in v19 if a component suspends, its siblings won't render anymore, leading to potential waterfalls. In many situations (using â€œfetch-on-renderâ€ pattern, using React.lazy()...), async code might run sequentially instead of in parallel. Thereâ€™s a good reason motivating this change: the ability to display Suspense fallbacks sooner, and avoid rendering components uselessly. In theory, waterfalls could be avoided if requests were â€œhoistedâ€ at the router level (using the â€œrender-as-you-fetchâ€ pattern), but many existing apps do not do that and would suffer from degraded performances.
segments.sourceMdx: Unlike React 18, in v19 if a component suspends, its siblings won't render anymore, leading to potential waterfalls. In many situations (using â€œfetch-on-renderâ€ pattern, using React.lazy()...), async code might run sequentially instead of in parallel. Thereâ€™s a good reason motivating this change: the ability to display Suspense fallbacks sooner, and avoid rendering components uselessly. In theory, waterfalls could be avoided if requests were â€œhoistedâ€ at the router level (using the â€œrender-as-you-fetchâ€ pattern), but many existing apps do not do that and would suffer from degraded performances.

segments.content: **[React Internals Explorer - easily see how React works](https://jser.dev/2024-05-11-introducing-rie/)**
segments.sourceMdx: **[React Internals Explorer - easily see how React works](https://jser.dev/2024-05-11-introducing-rie/)**

segments.content: A new interactive playground to see how React works under the hood. Itâ€™s possible to explore internals step-by-step. You can even select the React version, and itâ€™s particularly relevant for todayâ€™s issue because it can show the Suspense behavior difference between React 18 and React 19!

You can even select the React version, and itâ€™s particularly relevant for todayâ€™s issue because it can show the Suspense behavior difference between React 18 and React 19!

segments.content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Meilisearch - Build search-as-you-type for React](https://www.meilisearch.com/with/react?utm_campaign=sponsoring&utm_content=june-19&utm_source=thisweekinreact)
- ğŸ‘€ [React Core PR - Badge Environment Name on Thrown Errors from the Server](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/29846): A convenient DX improvement to know where the error comes from thanks to a [server] console badge.
- ğŸ¦ [React Router 7 - Ryan Florence Sneak Peek video](https://x.com/ryanflorence/status/1801388170891903252)
- ğŸ—“ï¸ [The Geek Conf](https://www.thegeekconf.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª Berlin - 18 & 25 July - Get a 10% discount with code "TWIR". Tomasz Sapeta (Expo/Software Mansion), Carmen Huidobro (DevCraft Academy), and Atila Fassina (CrabNebula) will speak !
- ğŸ—“ [dotJS](https://www.dotjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡· Paris - June 27 - Just 1 week left before the conference! 10% discount with code "TWIR"
- ğŸ“œ [Codemod partnering with the React team](https://codemod.com/blog/react-announcement): The Codemod company is partnering with React to maintain the react-codemod repo and help us upgrade to React 19.
- ğŸ“œ [Future of Astro series - Zero-JS view transitions, Astro Content Layer, and Server Islands](https://astro.build/blog/future-of-astro-zero-js-view-transitions/): Astro betting on new browser features like cross-document view transitions makes us question the need for client-side routing and SPAs. I hope theyâ€™ll figure out how to persist component state across navigation in this new mode. They also plan to improve their (CMS integration, composable, using LibSQL) and provide a new â€œserver:deferâ€ directive (similar to Suspense, but not using streaming).
- ğŸ“œ [Demystifying INP: New tools and actionable insights](https://vercel.com/blog/demystifying-inp-new-tools-and-actionable-insights): Vercel CTO explains that the new Core Web Vital INP (Interaction to Next Paint) is a misleading metric. Surprisingly preloading data can even give you a lower INP score. Using a React example from the Next.js docs site (js/ts code block language picker), he explains that user input must be acknowledged within 200ms. He suggests using either his package â€œawait-interaction-responseâ€ or React transitions to separate user input handling from rendering the meaningful result.
- ğŸ“œ [Experimenting with React Server Components and Vite](https://danielnagy.me/posts/Post_usaivhdu3j5d): A quite advanced article recreating a RSC setup with Vite from scratch. Very useful resource for framework authors looking to support RSCs. All this work to run a blog for your cat Dan ğŸ˜„.
- ğŸ“œ [How to compose JavaScript functions that take multiple parameters](https://jrsinclair.com/articles/2024/how-to-compose-functions-that-take-multiple-parameters-epic-guide/): Shows how to use a compose() function with React useState, among other things that will interest functional programming enthusiasts.
- ğŸ“œ [React Form with Loading State (Pending Action)](https://www.robinwieruch.de/react-form-loading-pending-action/): Shows 3 possible ways to can get the loading state of a form, using useActionState, useFormStatus and useTransition.
- ğŸ“œ [Redwood â€œLove reloaded" - A DX Story](https://redwoodjs.com/blog/love-reloaded-a-dx-story): Redwood briefly explains the tradeoffs of 3 instant feedback mechanisms. For their RSC experience, theyâ€™ll start by shipping live reload, and plan to implement fast refresh later.
- ğŸ“œ [Using React Query with Astro](https://hounie.me/writings/how-to-use-react-query-with-astro/): Using nanostores instead of React Context.
- ğŸ“œ [Next.js Server Actions with next-safe-action](https://www.davegray.codes/posts/nextjs-server-actions-with-next-safe-action): The library handles typesafety and input validation (with zod).
- ğŸ“œ [Hybrid i18n with Next and Astro - 4-part series](https://www.ericburel.tech/blog/hybrid-i18n-next-astro-1)
- ğŸ“œ [Write SOLID React Hooks](https://www.perssondennis.com/articles/write-solid-react-hooks)
- ğŸ“œ [Full Stack Web Push API Guide - Add push notifications to Remix Indie Stack](https://www.bocoup.com/blog/full-stack-web-push-api-guide)
- ğŸ“¦ [React DevTools 5.3 - Dim StrictMode extra console logs, fixes and refactors](https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/main/packages/react-devtools/CHANGELOG.md#530)
- ğŸ“¦ [Vercel AI SDK 3.2](https://vercel.com/blog/introducing-vercel-ai-sdk-3-2): you can now build generative UI chatbots client-side with just useChat() and streamText in your React projects
- ğŸ“¦ [Reassure 1.0 - Performance testing companion for React and React Native](https://github.com/callstack/reassure/releases/tag/reassure%401.0.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [Fumadocs 12 - Documentation framework for Next.js](https://fumadocs.vercel.app/blog/v12)
- ğŸ“¦ [react-distributed-components - Effortlessly compose client and server components](https://github.com/daniel-nagy/react-distributed-components)
- ğŸ“¦ [tscircuit - Design Electronics with React & AI](https://tscircuit.com/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Relay 17.0](https://github.com/facebook/relay/releases/tag/v17.0.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [Sonner 1.5 - Toast library - x3 smaller and many other improvements](https://github.com/emilkowalski/sonner/releases/tag/v.1.5.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [Remix Privacy Stack - Indie Stack + GDPR/CCPA flows + self-hosted](https://www.bocoup.com/blog/announcing-the-privacy-stack-for-remix)
- ğŸ¥ [Delba - Next.js: Authentication (Best Practices for Server Components, Actions, Middleware)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N_sUsq_y10U)
- ğŸ¥ [Jolly Coding - Why You Should Use React Aria Components](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lTPh6NGLAmk)

segments.content: As there is no â€œbig headline newsâ€ this week, I want to take the opportunity to celebrate two projects within the React Native community. The team behind React Native [visionOS received the React Open Source Award](https://x.com/michalchudziak/status/1801632496100008121) in the category â€œMost Exciting Use of Technology,â€ and the team at Infinite Red released the [300th episode of the React Native Radio](https://reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-300-special-episode-ask-us-anything) podcast this week. Congratulations to both teams and thank you for the work you all do for our community!
segments.sourceMdx: As there is no â€œbig headline newsâ€ this week, I want to take the opportunity to celebrate two projects within the React Native community. The team behind React Native [visionOS received the React Open Source Award](https://x.com/michalchudziak/status/1801632496100008121) in the category â€œMost Exciting Use of Technology,â€ and the team at Infinite Red released the [300th episode of the React Native Radio](https://reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-300-special-episode-ask-us-anything) podcast this week. Congratulations to both teams and thank you for the work you all do for our community!

segments.content:
* ğŸ’¸ [WithFrame - Pre-Built React Native Components](https://withfra.me/?utm_source=thisweekinreact\&utm_medium=email\&utm_campaign=quick-link--3)
* ğŸ¦ [React Native visionOS receives React Open Source Award](https://x.com/michalchudziak/status/1801632496100008121): Congratulations!
* ğŸ¦ [New React Native IDE beta with speed improvements](https://x.com/kzzzf/status/1801367065086816449)
* ğŸ‘€ [React Native 0.75 PRs - bump dependency to React 19](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/pull/44990)
* ğŸ‘€ [React Native PR - requestIdleCallback ](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/pull/44759): Schedule background and low-priority work on the main event loop.
* ğŸ“– [Expo Docs - React Compiler - Available from Expo SDK 51](https://docs.expo.dev/guides/react-compiler/): Still experimental, of course.
* ğŸ—“ [Chain React Conf](https://chainreactconf.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ Portland, OR - July 17-19. The U.S. React Native Conference is back with engaging talks and hands-on workshops! Get 15% off your ticket with code â€œTWIRâ€
* ğŸ“œ [Infinite Red maintains a list of the Top React Native Apps](https://shift.infinite.red/top-react-native-apps-1cae78fdee22): I didnâ€™t know Burger King and Pizza Hut apps were built with RN. If you know of a great app that should be on that list, you can nominate it - even if itâ€™s not a fast food chain!
* ğŸ“œ [Reanimated Can Block Your JS Thread](https://andrei-calazans.com/posts/reanimated-blocking-js-thread/): Yes, you can shoot yourself in the foot when using shared values, this is a good reminder to evaluate whether a value needs to be a Shared Value.
* ğŸ“œ [Testing Expo Web3 Apps With Wagmi and Anvil](https://www.callstack.com/blog/testing-expo-web3-apps-with-wagmi-and-anvil): Even if youâ€™re like me and instantly fall asleep when you hear the word Web3 these days, this article is a good example walkthrough of different aspects of testing, including mocking.
* ğŸ“œ [Baseball + React Native = Success](https://www.thewidlarzgroup.com/portfolio/flexpro-grip): I love seeing apps built with RN that are a bit unusual (and not just consist of lists of records). This is an example of such an app for the FlexPro Grip, a device that Baseball players use to train their grip.
* ğŸ“œ [Bringing native AI to your mobile apps with ExecuTorchâ€” part I â€” iOS](https://blog.swmansion.com/bringing-native-ai-to-your-mobile-apps-with-executorch-part-i-ios-f1562a4556e8)
* ğŸ“¦ [react-navigation-bottom-sheet](https://github.com/th3rdwave/react-navigation-bottom-sheet): Iâ€™m a big fan of @gorhom/bottom-sheet, this new library integrates it with React Navigation.
* ğŸ“¦ [react-native-screens 3.32.0 - Back button display mode on iOS, navigationBarTranslucent prop on Android](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-screens/releases/tag/3.32.0)
* ğŸ“¦ [react-native-config 1.5.2 adds visionOS support](https://github.com/lugg/react-native-config/releases/tag/v1.5.2)
* ğŸ“¦ [react-native-gesture-handler 2.17.0](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-gesture-handler/releases/tag/2.17.0)
* ğŸ™ï¸ [RNR 300 - Special Episode: Ask Us Anything!](https://reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-300-special-episode-ask-us-anything)
* ğŸ™ï¸ [Rocket Ship 43 - React Native Best Practices Template with Youssouf El Azizi](https://share.transistor.fm/s/cc24a442)
* ğŸ¥ [notJustâ€¤dev - Building an e-Scooter App with React Native and Mapbox](https://www.youtube.com/live/uxj8jnlooP8)
* ğŸ¥ [Simon Grimm - 5 React Native Tips to Wow Your Users](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pZgjlh5ezd4)
* ğŸ¥ [Baptiste Devessier - XState at Expo](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HuXnUGfHKZs): TIL that Expo Updates uses XState.
